intro: Merendera aitchisonii, commonly known as the Aitchison's merendera, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
